p:
Since 2016, Zika incidence in Brazil has dropped precipitously, from over 200,000 probable cases in 2016 to 18,548 in 2017
25 . In Colombia incidence dropped from approximately 90,000 in 2016 to 1641 in 2017
25 . These reductions are likely the result of widespread immunity throughout affected populations, leaving few individuals susceptible to infection. Multiple human and animal studies show that ZIKV induces potently neutralizing antibody responses
26, 27 , suggesting enduring ZIKV-specific immunity
28 .
